member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.UDPConnection.IgnoreICMPDestinationUnreachable
member.summary: By default a UDP datagram sent to an unreachable destination will result in an ICMP Destination Unreachable packet. This can result in a SocketException on the local end. To avoid this behaviour these ICMP packets are ignored by default, i.e. this value is set to true. Setting this value to false could cause new UDP connections to close, possibly unexpectedly.

member.name: T:NetworkCommsDotNet.UDPOptions
member.summary: A could support different combinations of features. i.e. From the most basic (None) which sends conectionless UDP packets upto an emulated TCP. Future versions of NetworkCommsDotNet will support an ever increasing number of UDP features. This flag enum is used to specifiy which of the available features should be used.

member.name: F:NetworkCommsDotNet.UDPOptions.None
member.summary: The most basic UDP option. All UDP packets are sent connectionless with no error handling, sequencing or duplication prevention.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.HostName
member.summary: Returns the current machine hostname

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.AllowedIPPrefixes
member.summary: If set NetworkCommsDotNet will only operate on matching IP Addresses. Also see . Correct format is string[] { "192.168", "213.111.10" }. If multiple prefixes are provided the earlier prefix, if found, takes priority.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.AllowedAdaptorNames
member.summary: If set NetworkCommsDotNet will only operate on specified adaptors. Correct format is string[] { "eth0", "en0", "wlan0" }.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.DefaultListenPort
member.summary: The default port NetworkCommsDotNet will operate on

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.NetworkIdentifier
member.summary: The local identifier for this instance of NetworkCommsDotNet. This is an application unique identifier.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.CurrentRuntimeEnvironment
member.summary: The current runtime environment. Detected automatically on startup. Performance may be adversly affected if this is changed.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.NetworkLoadUpdateWindowMS
member.summary: The number of millisconds over which to take an instance load (CurrentNetworkLoad) to be used in averaged values (AverageNetworkLoad). Default is 2000ms. Shorter values can be used but less than 200ms may cause significant errors in the value of returned value, especially in mono environments.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.InterfaceLinkSpeed
member.summary: The interface link speed in bits/sec used for network load calculations. Default is 100Mb/sec

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.CurrentNetworkLoadIncoming
member.summary: Returns the current instance network usage, as a value between 0 and 1. Returns the largest value for any available network adaptor. Triggers load analysis upon first call.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.CurrentNetworkLoadOutgoing
member.summary: Returns the current instance network usage, as a value between 0 and 1. Returns the largest value for any available network adaptor. Triggers load analysis upon first call.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.ConnectionListenModeUseSync
member.summary: Used for switching between async and sync connectionListen modes. Default is false. No noticable performance difference between the two modes.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.ListenOnAllAllowedInterfaces
member.summary: Used for switching between listening on a single interface or multiple interfaces. Default is true. See and

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.ReceiveBufferSizeBytes
member.summary: Receive data buffer size. Default is 80KB. CAUTION: Changing the default value can lead to performance degredation.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.SendBufferSizeBytes
member.summary: Send data buffer size. Default is 80KB. CAUTION: Changing the default value can lead to performance degredation.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.CommsThreadPool
member.summary: The threadpool used by networkComms.Net to execute incoming packet handlers.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.EnablePacketCheckSumValidation
member.summary: When enabled uses an MD5 checksum to validate all received packets. Default is false, relying on any possible connection checksum alone. Also when enabled any packets sent less than CheckSumMismatchSentPacketCacheMaxByteLimit will be cached for a duration to ensure successful delivery. Default false.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.CheckSumMismatchSentPacketCacheMaxByteLimit
member.summary: When checksum validation is enabled sets the limit below which sent packets are cached to ensure successful delivery. Default 75KB.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.MinimumSentPacketCacheTimeMinutes
member.summary: When a sent packet has been cached for a possible resend this is the minimum length of time it will be retained. Default is 1.0 minutes.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.LastSentPacketCacheCleanup
member.summary: Records the last sent packet cache cleanup time. Prevents the sent packet cache from being checked too frequently.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.IgnoreUnknownPacketTypes
member.summary: If true any unknown incoming packet types are ignored. Default is false and will result in an error file being created if an unknown packet type is received.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.ConnectionEstablishTimeoutMS
member.summary: Time to wait in milliseconds before throwing an exception when waiting for a connection to be established. Default is 30000.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.PacketConfirmationTimeoutMS
member.summary: Time to wait in milliseconds before throwing an exception when waiting for confirmation of packet receipt. Default is 5000.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.ConnectionAliveTestTimeoutMS
member.summary: Time to wait in milliseconds before assuming a remote connection is dead when doing a connection test. Default is 1000.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.DisableConnectionSendTimeouts
member.summary: By deefault NetworkComms.Net closes connections for which sends take a long time. The timeout is calculated based on previous connection send performances. Set this to true to disable this feature.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.LoggingEnabled
member.summary: Returns true if comms logging has been enabled.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.Logger
member.summary: Access the NetworkCommsDotNet logger externally.

member.name: P:NetworkCommsDotNet.NetworkComms.InternalFixedSendReceiveOptions
member.summary: The following are used for internal comms objects, packet headers, connection establishment etc. We generally seem to increase the size of our data if compressing small objects (~50 bytes) Given the typical header size is 40 bytes we might as well not compress these objects.
